results.title: Australian steel : progress in Port Kembla
results.brief_description: Iron and steel production at Port Kembla, N.S.W. is linked with quarrying limestone at Iron Monarch and Cockatoo Island, limestones at Marulan and coal mining. A documentary style explanation of processes , products and progression of iron and steel production and coal mining.
results.description: Iron and steel production at Port Kembla, N.S.W. is linked with quarrying limestone at Iron Monarch and Cockatoo Island, limestones at Marulan and coal mining. A documentary style explanation of processes , products and progression of iron and steel production and coal mining.

A documentary style explanation of processes , products and progression of iron and steel production and coal mining.

results.title: Australian notebook. No. 5
results.brief_description: Newsreel magazine containing the following items: 1. Albert Park Lake proves new attraction for weekend walkers 2. Agriculture Minister Chandler opens a tree-pruning demo at Burnley Horticultural Gardens 3. Labrador retrievers display ability in club trials at Templestowe 4. Fisheries and Game Department supervisors release 20,000 young trout in the Yarra River 5. Sports brief - Lacrosse at Malvern, hockey with Camberwell v Power House for Altona Cup.

results.title: Australian Notebook. No. 2
results.brief_description: This cinemagazine contains historical items of Victorian history including: Country fire fighters in annual event at Chelsea; Veteran cars in rally - Melbourne/Brighton time trial; Ancient petrol rail car service in Melbourne suburb, Vic Rail introduce new suburban train - Blue Train; St Kilda-Brighton Electric tramway celebrates 50 years service.

results.title: Australian modernists 1916-1942
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
Features “Down the Hills to Berry’s Bay” : Roland Wakelin’s painting of Post-Impressionist style. “Rhythmic Composition in Yellow Green Minor” : An abstract painting by Roy de Maistre. “Study for Dog Gymkhana”: “Cubism art in Australia”. “Flying Over the Shoalhaven River”: The Work of Margaret Preston.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia

results.brief_description: A film by cartoonist Bruce Petty using graphics and animation to present a satirical view of Australian history from early settlement to the present.

results.title: Australian gold rushes. - Years 7-10.
results.brief_description: Provides a general overview of the Australian gold rush period 1850-1900. It is presented in three segments: 1. “Discoveries”. - 2. “Gold rushes 1800-1900”. - 3. “Mining methods”. Consists of re-enactments, segments from early Australian feature films and stills from the period. This video would also be suitable for younger students.
results.description: Provides a general overview of the Australian gold rush period 1850-1900. It is presented in three segments: 1. “Discoveries”. - 2. “Gold rushes 1800-1900”. - 3. “Mining methods”. Consists of re-enactments, segments from early Australian feature films and stills from the period. This video would also be suitable for younger students.

results.title: Australian football
results.creator_credit: Bruce Andrew, Australian Football Council and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: This film explains and demonstrates the following Australian rules terms: drop kick, punt kick, stab kick, place kick, highmarking, chest marking, hand ball, turning and baulking, tackling, ruck play, shepherding and blocking. Commentary by Eric Welch.

results.title: Australian food parade
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film surveys in part Australia’s fruit and cattle industries and indicates their potentialities. There are scenes from the Royal Agricultural Society’s Easter Show in Sydney.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Otton, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
